abstract: The Financial Conduct Authority is looking at banks’ efforts to compensate consumers who have filed complaints of improper sales of loan insurance, claims that have already cost banks about $26 billion.
snippet: The Financial Conduct Authority is looking at banks’ efforts to compensate consumers who have filed complaints of improper sales of loan insurance, claims that have already cost banks about $26 billion.

headline.main: British Regulators Assessing Loan Insurance Compensation Efforts
